uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.jdbc.table

Class TableSpecification

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.jdbc.table.TableSpecification

  • public class TableSpecification
extends java.lang.Object
    Table Description. We use an abstract representation to make it easier to port between database back-ends. We can also store optional fields. These are not created by default but might be presented as options when editing the table structure. Normally a handler class will create this programmatically which can be used to create the underlying table if it does not exist. This can be customised by setting configuration parameters though obviously these need to be in place before the table is created. Configuration parameters are of the form create_table.table.field=specification Where the specification is one of:
    • double
    • float
    • int
    • long
    • date
    • boolean
    • stringxxx where xxx is the string length
    • required - promote an optional field
    • table-tag reference to remote table
